slide.teacher_notes: Revise the previous class before proceeding to the next slide

li.p: Can we calculate total in column I ?
Can we calculate the percentagesreceived by each student?
Can we find out the difference inmarks between two students ?

slide.teacher_notes: Ask the students and get answers from them
slide.h1: Can we perform calculations in excel?

slide.teacher_notes: "=" indicates that excel should perform a function / calculation
In excel we can perform calculations by directly inputting values or keying in the values in various cells and summing them up in a different cell
We can add, subtract, multiply or divide in excel
tn
Trainer may open an excel and show it to the students that it will not work without "="
slide.h1: What happens if '=' is not used?

li.p: Type the formula in the target cell (B4)=A2 A3
Type '=' and then you can select the first cell (A2) with a mouse click, type ' ', select the second cell (A3) with the mouse
You can also select cells using thearrow keys to move around. What doyou see when you move it?

slide.teacher_notes: Trainer to demonstrate all the three ways in class
Play the video and give time for students to try the same
Next slide is a few examples for students to try in class
Give time to students to try these calculations
Give time to students to try these calculations in class
Ask the students what does function mean in excel
Ask the students and get answers from them
slide.h1: How can we calculate the sum total in cell I4?

slide.teacher_notes: Stress on the fact that manual calculations cannot be done if there are large volumes of data
Give a couple of minutes to students to go through the home ribbon and figure out if sum can be calculated
Its the same table as activity 1 of session 3
Trainer to open excel & demonstrate the same in class. Tell the students to apply this formula to all the totals
Give time to students to try this on their own. Trainer to open excel & demonstrate the same in class
Ask the formula to calculate percentage and then disclose the image
Right now the percentages are in decimal format we have to apply percentage format to the same
